title: An operatorâ€™s guide to product strategy | Chandra Janakiraman (CPO at VRChat, ex-Meta, Headspace)
key_insights: Strategy sits between mission/vision and roadmap, forcing choices to deploy scarce resources for maximum impact
Use a 5-stage process over 8-12 weeks: preparation, strategy sprint, design sprint, document writing, and rollout
Form a strategy working group with engineering, product design, and data to create collaborative ownership
Generate problems first, cluster them, flip to opportunities, then rank on 4 criteria: impact, certainty, clarity of levers, and differentiation
Conduct leadership interviews early to avoid the 'fruit story' - understanding preferences before building strategy
Strategy has no business value until tested through execution - be ready to pivot based on results
Run small-S (2-year, problem-focused) and big-S (5-10 year, aspirational) strategy work in parallel
AI can assist with competitive analysis and mock strategy generation, but human judgment still needed for focus and context

guest_background.current_role: Chief Product Officer and Executive Vice President at VRChat

topics_discussed: Strategy working group formation and management
Multi-agent AI systems for product optimization
memorable_quotes: Strategy sits between the mission and vision and the plan. It forces choice to deploy scarce resources to generate maximum impact.
Life's got to be about more than just solving problems. There needs to be an aspirational and cool component to strategy.
Any strategy is only as good as the results it produces. So test and iterate through execution and double down on what's working and pivot away from what's not.
frameworks_mentioned: Strategic pillar ranking criteria (impact, certainty, clarity of levers, differentiation)
Newspaper headline approach for winning aspiration
recommended_for: product managers seeking structured strategy approaches
product leaders responsible for team strategy
summary: Chandra Janakiraman shares a battle-tested, 5-stage process for developing product strategy that emphasizes collaborative problem identification, systematic prioritization, and organizational alignment. The conversation provides a concrete, step-by-step playbook that transforms strategy from mystical art to repeatable science.
